1.text: Remember, O Jehovah, what was to us: look and see our reproach.

2.text: Our inheritance was turned to strangers, our houses to foreigners.

3.text: We were orphans, no father; our mothers as widows.

4.text: We drank our water for silver; our wood will come for a price.

5.text: Upon our necks were we pursued: we labored and no rest to us.

6.text: We gave the hand to Egypt, to Assur, to be filled with bread.

7.text: Our fathers sinned, they are not; we bore their iniquities.

8.text: Servants ruled over us: none delivering from their hand.

9.text: With our souls we shall bring our bread from the face of the sword of the desert.

10.text: Our skin was scorched as a furnace from the face of the violent heat of famine.

11.text: They humbled the women in Zion the virgins in the cities of Judah.

12.text: Chiefs were hung by their hand: the faces of old men were not honored.

13.text: They took away the chosen ones to grind, and the young men were weak in the wood.

14.text: Old men ceased from the gate, the chosen ones from their stringed instruments.

15.text: The joy of our heart ceased; our dance was turned to mourning.

16.text: The crown of our head fell: wo! now to us, for we sinned.

17.text: For this our heart was languid; for this our eyes were darkened.

18.text: For mount Zion was laid waste, the foxes went upon it.

19.text: Thou, O Jehovah, shalt dwell forever; thy throne to generation and generation.

20.text: Wherefore wilt thou forget us forever? wilt thou forsake us to length of days?

21.text: Turn us back, O Jehovah, to thee, and we shall be turned; renew our days as of old.

22.text: But rejecting, thou didst reject us; thou wert angry against us even greatly.
